data.event: The county was created in 1848 and organized in 1853.
The county was created in 1848 and organized in 1853.

event.title: 1836, Portage County was created and included

data.event: In 1836, Portage County was created and included most of present-day Columbia County, including the city of Portage, Wisconsin.
In 1846, Portage County was renamed Columbia County.

event.title: 1848, the southern part of Portage County was renamed

data.event: In 1848, the southern part of Portage County was renamed Adams County and included all of current-day Adams County and the northern section of Juneau County.
Adams County was organized in April 1853.

event.title: 1858, The northwestern part of Adams County was joined

data.event: In 1858, The northwestern part of Adams County was joined with the northern part of Sauk County to form present-day Juneau County.
